values.comments:
This course examines the field of public finance in theory and in practice. The purpose of the course is to provide a detailed understanding of the many facets of and applications of finance in the public sector with a focus on public finance investment banking. The course will provide students with a broad-based and technical overview of public finance and municipal bonds as well as a thorough understanding of the business of public finance.

Students mentioned that this was a “great course” but “would have liked more math.” Others commented that the course is “well-designed, and obviously time-tested.” Another student stated, “the structure of the course, which features periodic quizzes on separate units, combined with problem sets, is very effective.” One student mentioned in regards to the course that “I got out of it what I hoped I would,” but a negative is that the quizzes were on material that was different from what was covered in class.

Overall, students had high regard for Professor Matteo. They commented that he “really knows his stuff and was able to explain it in a way that everyone could understand,” and “is passionate about it.” Another student stated that he “was very engaging and presented the material well.”

This course is usually intended for students majoring in Government Administration. However, non-majors are welcome to take this course as well. One student mentioned that the course “was hard for international students whose first language is not English.” In addition, there are no assigned readings for this course and “the weekly non-graded assignments were helpful.” There are no prerequisites for this course.
